title: ram bagh
review: its also known as aram bagh one of oldest park of mughal dynasty haing good collection of flowers and tress enjoy it

title: the garden of relaxation
review: Ram Bagh is the oldest Mughal garden existent today, and is now a part of the Rambagh Palace Hotel. In 1528, Emperor Babur built this Persian garden, which showcases great Islamic architecture. Ram Bagh means ‘the garden of relaxation’, and was thus built as a retreat for Babur. If you stay at the hotel, make sure you spend some time in the garden, too. The garden is open from sunrise to sunset. The entry fee for Indians is Rs. 10 and for foreigners it is Rs. 500.The best time to visit the garden is from October to March.

title: Ram bagh
review: It is quite old and viewable. In the morning there is a very pleasant atmosphere. There are many types of flower trees in the garden.

title: First Mughal Garden!!!!
review: It's a first Mughal garden in Agra, built by Mughal Emperor Babur. Beautiful garden with beautiful flowers and lovely trees. Early morning very pleasant atmosphere. Relaxing with a lovely evening.

title: Excellent monument, nice place to visit
review: The architecture is brilliant. People are friendly and safe to travel around. Very hot and humid is summer.

title: Oldest Mughal garden
review: During my vacation in Agra, I had visited this beautiful Mughal garden called Ram Bagh. Entrance tickets to this garden is cheap - 10 rupees for Indians and 200 for foreigners. This is the oldest Mughal garden in India built by first Mughal Emperor Babar. We liked the well maintained manicured lawns, big trees and the many pathways & canals(no water though) criss crossing the garden. We enjoyed clicking pics on the 2 pavilions showcasing Mughal architecture and facing the Yamuna river. Many locals can be found relaxing in the garden.

title: Serene place with healthy environment
review: Rambagh surely is a breathe of relaxation in the middle of polluted foundry nagar & national high way. Huge place vastly extended with lot of vegetation around.

title: Amazingly changed and fantastic restoration, cheers for ASI
review: I am astonished by seeing the beauty of this garden, visited after 20 long years ago, looked like garden of Kashmir by its architecture, restoration and preservation deserves appreciation. Even during summers cool winds are blowing due to nearness of river yamuna. Excellant place to visit

title: Garden Of Rest Built By Defender Of faith
review: India the most diverse nation and large from Great Himalaya in the North and the tropical peninsular South, has great legacy of this Ancient country. This Country has a great acceptance of Invaders like Aryans and others. But 1526, a Tiger entry, through Panipat and Khnwa, of Zahir Uddin Muhammad Babur, who was a King at the age of just 12 Years of Fergana presently Uzbekistan and direct descendant of Timur and Genghis Khan and faced lot of setbacks, succeeded to establish the Mughal Court or Mughal Dynasty In India at Agra. The beginning of the most exciting era, and The Ram Bagh, Aram Bagh Garden Of Rest and also called the Bagh-I-Noor Afshan Light Scattering Garden, originally built by Babur Defender Of Faith, in 1528. It is a Persian design, pathways, canals, viewing pavilions facing to Great Jumna River and a beautiful series of water cascades, no doubt a great attraction and also have the special summer undergrounds. This place had become the temporary burial after his death on 26 Dec 1530, and later moved to the Bagh-E-Babur, in Kabul. In my view this review must be interesting as nobody was aware that The Golden era's foundation was laid, by this great Emperor a Defender of Faith

title: From Aaram Bagh to  Ram Bagh
review: It has been built by Babar in the year 1530 and it is said that when Babar died his remains was kept here for few days before they were taken to Kabul.Earlier its name was Aaram bagh during Marathas they change it to Ram Bagh

title: Relaxing Experience
review: Our guide explained us that, at this very place Akbar proposed his third wife and after 6 days she relented. He also explained us that the main purpose of building this garden was to have an escape from the hot summers in this region. Different variety of flowers can be easily seen by walking around the garden.  This place has a soothing effect on our mind and it can be easily described as the best place to view Taj.

title: Obsolete park forgotten by authorities
review: Once a good place to visit, this park feels like a heritage of bygone era these days. Authorities have completely forgotten to upkeep it and are more interested in popular attractions like Agra Fort and Taj Mahal.

title: Ram Bagh - An Old Mughal Garden
review: This garden is supposed to be the oldest garden built by the first  Mughal emperor Babur. Although it is historically significant the garden has not received the importance it deserves and when we went it was not maintained well.

title: Ram Bagh, Agra
review: The oldest Mughal garden in India, the Ram Bagh was built by the Emperor Babar in 1528 on the bank of the Yamuna. It lies about 2.34 km north of the Tāj Mahal. I visited this garden on a day when I visited Taj Mahal With Family, It is a good place to relax.

title: Old Garden!!!
review: Ram Bagh is the oldest Mughal garden situated in Agra village, Agra. Its a  historical garden. The place was very beautiful.

title: Ram bagh
review: Ram bagh has its historical value..it is a quite decent place to spent weekend..place is well main tend and beautifull

title: Mughal Gardens
review: Said to be the oldest Mughal garden built by Babur, it will give you a fair idea on the way the Mughals laid out their gardens. It is fairly maintained and you can spend an hour wandering and relaxing here.

title: A good garden
review: While coming to Agra from Yamuna Express way, this is first tourist attraction in Agra.

title: Terrible
review: This is really not a gud garden to visit. Very badly maintained . Lot of trash every where. At the end of the visit we were cursing ourself why we came here.

title: India's First terrace garden
review: It is not that much maintained now a days but actually this is really a very good place for picnic if you are carrying your food .

title: Very Average
review: Ram Bagh is a place of historiacal importance, still I won't personally recommend people to visit this place. It is not at all maintained by the government and it has lots of trash here and there. Lats but not the least, this site has nothing to showcase its historical importance at this juncture of time.

title: Garden of Rest-Aram Bagh
review: It is said as the oldest garden built by Mughal Emprors. This is a persian garden, where pathways and canals divide the garden. English name is Garden of Rest.Nur Jahan as said to be its designer. You can visit the place for 1 hour.

title: Ram bagh
review: It's also known as aram Bagh first Mughal garden having beautiful collection of flowers and trees enjoy it

title: Peaceful
review: Its just a garden well planned and well maintained. Very breezy and cool as its just on the bank of The Yamuna.

title: Great Location!
review: This is great for the family to visit and children will love it. If your into your history this is the place to learn some interesting facts.

title: Poorly Managed
review: Dont bother to go there and waste your time. Its a simple park in middle of a busy road with no view.

title: Nothing to visit and View
review: Don't waste time to go to this place... its not even worth.. you will spend Rs 50 in outside parking and inside you won't be able to see anything as its always constructing there... from past 10 years... still its ongoing...

title: Oldest Archaeological site of Mughal Dynasty
review: This garden was built by Babur the first emperor of Mughal Dynasty. It has large lawns and old trees all over, but as it ill maintained the love birds and local goons crowd the garden. The entrance is over crowed by fruit sellers and encroachers. A great monument lost in negligence.

title: Very poor management
review: A historical mughal garden neglected by the concerned authorities. maintenance are very poor .looks like an ordinary garden.

title: great place to visit
review: simply a must place and will rate it as good as taj Mahal ,Nice marbel work with the good design will miss some thing great if not visiting it .

title: Nice garden, difficult to reach, terrible staff
review: This garden is far from other touristic attractions. We get there on foot, and it wasn't a completely pleasant walk, as you must pass through several bazaars, and people will stare at you continuously as you are an attraction.

title: Interesting if you have time
review: These gardens are in disrepair, although you can get a sense of the grandier at one time. It does give you a good view of the city, but do this only if you have seen the other sites of Agra such as the Taj Mahal, Agra Fort and the Tomb of Itmad-ud-Daulah and Sikandra.

title: Aaram Bagh
review: Ram Bagh,nam come from Aaram Bagh, which was built by the Mughal Emperor Baburto be  used during the hot summers to provide relief to visitors. It is very old Bagh but not so properly maintained. If you have plenty of tome in hand then you can have a visit to this garden.

title: Persian Garden
review: It was built by Babur the great mughal emperor in the year 1528. He proposed his 3rd wife and waited for 6 days untill she accepted her proposal.

title: Greenery everywhere
review: I liked Ram Bagh,the nice manicured lawns and variety of plants,a serene place.I loved to walk around and saw variety of roses.It is almost like a breathing area for the people of Agra.Otherwise Agra in the congested localities is too polluted to one's liking.

title: Splendid Garden !!
review: Ram Bagh, which was built by the Mughal Emperor Babur. It is the oldest Mughal garden in India.  Popularly known as Aaram Bagh, this garden was used during the hot summers to provide relief to visitors.  So there by most of the visitors make a visit to this Ram Bagh.

title: Unknown heritage
review: This is a gem of a garden not known very well even to the locals. Quite well preserved. It is awe-inspiring to know that this multilevel royal garden was created on plain bank of river Yamuna and was patronized for over 400 years.

title: Feel like a King and Queen!
review: We stayed at Rambagh Palace Taj Hotel. no words to describe. The palace, service, food, ambience, spa, entertainment, peacocks at the facility and great surprises for our honeymoon. Two thumps up!

title: not good
review: It is very crowded place in Agra. Lots of transport markets are there. You can visit this place if you have nothing to do or want something for your bike!!

title: Rambagh: Babur's Gift to India
review: When Babur came to India, he was tired of seeing grey and brown all around him. He longed for the greens of Samarkhand and wanted to recreate it over here. So he took up the project of creating beautiful gardens and Arambagh (later turning to Rambagh) was the outcome.

title: Yes, a must!
review: I was very surprised how much there is to see in Agra - take advantage of seeing these sites.

title: ram bagh
review: its also known as aram bagh one of oldest park of mughal dynasty haing good collection of flowers and tress enjoy it

title: beautiful garden
review: one can see after 100 years but temples renovation work going on,we are spell bound to see such a good temple near agra

title: Babur's Garden
review: A beautiful orchard by the banks of the city offers great views of the River Yamuna. A pavement of red sandstone runs through the middle of the entire garden, with inlays cut for water flows!
